Government 101

page.normal_text:
The US Federal government has three branches:
The US Federal government has three branches:

page.title:
Executive Branch 101
Executive Branch 101
page.normal_text:
The Executive Branch implements policy set by an administration and laws passed by Congress
The Executive Branch implements policy set by an
administration and laws passed by Congress

Done through a variety of agencies
Done through a variety of agencies

Some have cabinet secretaries as head
Some have cabinet secretaries as head

State, Defense, Labor, Energy, Homeland Security, Health and Human Services, etc
State, Defense, Labor, Energy, Homeland Security, Health
and Human Services, etc

Some do not
Some do not

National Science Foundation, Agency for International Development, Office of the US Trade Representative
National Science Foundation, Agency for International
Development, Office of the US Trade Representative

Remember  Only one person in the whole EB is elected; everyone else works for him

Policy

page.title:
How does Congress make decisions?
How does Congress make decisions?
page.normal_text:
Relevant Subcommittees and Committees will have hearings
Relevant Subcommittees and Committees will have hearings

Hearings generally only last a few hours
Hearings generally only last a few hours

Typically have 1-6 witnesses
Typically have 1-6 witnesses

Rarely get more than a handful of Members at a hearing
Rarely get more than a handful of Members at a hearing

So many issues come before a typical Congress that each Member doesn’t have time– or even staff time– to become expert in them all
So many issues come before a typical Congress that each
Member doesn’t have time– or even staff time– to become M e m b e r

expert in them all

Members will specialize in different topics
Members will specialize in different topics

They follow each other’s leads on certain topics

There is another problem… Vast majority of Senators and Representatives are lawyers, not scientists, doctors, or much else Further, only few hundred of nearly 10,000 staffers on the Hill have any science or engineering background  Neither Members nor staff scientifically sophisticated Language a problem How scientists and engineers use language often different from how same words used in law

page.title:
What can you do?
What can you do? W h a t
c a n
y o u d o ?
page.normal_text:
Apply to be a Fellow
Apply to be a Fellow

Anyone with a Ph.D. in a physics-related topic can apply for the APS and AIP Congressional Science Fellowships (must be US citizen) or any of the AAAS Fellowships Prefer recent grads or someone who will work at least 5 more years (i.e. not final step to retirement!) Prefer at least Associate Professor-level candidates for AIP State Department Fellow
